Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lekanis lid; glaze mostly fired reddish brown; interior glazed; exterior: two animal friezes separated by narrow horizontal band; above, feline paws to left; below, panther (left foreleg and rump missing; fired black to red) and hindquarters of a boar (fired red), both to left.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 338, no. B402)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0785) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 91, pl. I, no. 6)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
